explanations.d: Parity check can detect any single-bit error by identifying a change in the expected parity, but it cannot reliably detect multi-bit errors.

questions.question: Which method of error detection uses only 1 redundant bit per unit of data?

explanations.b: Simple parity check adds only one redundant bit (parity bit) to each data unit to detect errors. It's the most basic form of error detection

explanations.a: The BCD number 1101111 contains 6 ones, which is an even number. Therefore, it has even parity.

questions.question: Applying an exhaustive list of tests on a model is very time-consuming. True or False?

explanations.a: Applying an exhaustive list of tests on a model is time-consuming because it requires evaluating all possible test cases, which can be computationally expensive and inefficient.

questions.question: Parity codes cannot be used to detect transmission errors in external data buses.

explanations.b: Parity codes can be used to detect transmission errors in external data buses, as they help identify errors by checking the parity (odd or even) of the transmitted data.
